results.title: The Widow of Saint Pierre = La Veuve de Saint-Pierre [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Epithete Films, Cinemaginaire, France 3 Cinema, France 2 Cinema, Frederic Brillion, Gilles Legrand and Patrice Leconte
results.brief_description: On a remote, desolate French island colony off the coast of Newfoundland, a prisoner (director Emir Kusturica in his onscreen debut), sentenced to death for murder, awaits the arrival of a guillotine from France. In the meantime he is placed under the custody of the Captain of the island’s fortress and military contingent (Daniel Auteuil). Rather than lock him away, the Captain places him in the custodianship of his wife, Madame La (Juliette Binoche) who teaches him how to write and, as their relationship deepens, gradually draws out his best qualities. His transformation from a inarticulate brute into a sensitive, caring man, threatens the authorities who, despite the prisoner’s increasing popularity with the island’s locals, are determined to see “justice” done. Based on an actual incident, “The Widow of Saint-Pierre” reveals how the will of the people can be thwarted by the few in power. As the film progresses, its emotional and political outcomes unfold in increasingly unpredictable directions. The inventive script, alternately serious and comic, combined with the sweeping cinematography and musical score make for a complex, rewarding film. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Wider world
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker and Julian Bryan Internation Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Shows typical services performed by Girl Scouts and Girl Guides in Mexico, Burma, Finland and the United Sates. Explains how the world wide movement of Girl Scouts and Girl Guides has helped to foster understanding and friendships among girls of many countries. Includes scenes of Mexican girls, teaching illiterates to read and writes, Finnish girls taking blind on an outing; and Burmese girls caring for children in a day nursery. Written and supervised by D. A. Pennebaker.

results.title: The Widening net 1945-
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
Covers the period from 1945 to 1985. Shows how the enormous intake of migrants from Britain, Western Europe and the ;Mediterranean alter the face of Australia; and notes how from the early 1970’s, with a changing economy, recruitment fluctuates and then dies down. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Wide window of Mr. Malone
results.creator_credit: Spectrum Associates Production and George Pitt
results.brief_description: Gives a fascinating look into the inner workings of one of the world’s great newspapers, The New York Times. Describes how the news is gathered from all over the world, how it is sifted, edited, analysed and commented upon, and how it is finally laid out, printed and distributed in the newspaper - all in one day. Narrated by Alexsander Scourby.

results.title: The Wicker man
results.creator_credit: Peter Snell, British Lion Film Productions and Robin Hardy
results.brief_description: A spell binding occult thriller by writer Anthony Shaffer. A policeman goes to a remote Scottish Island to investigate the disappearance of a local girl and discovers a society of modern pagans worshipping the ancient gods of Earth, Rain and Sun. They are led by a sinister overlord in erotic rituals and savage ceremonies of human sacrifice and weave a web of hedonistic pleasure and terror around the puritanical, holier-than-thou policeman. When he finally discovers what happened to the girl, his nightmare is only just beginning!

results.title: The Whole world over
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB, Don Haldane and Leonard Forest
results.brief_description: A trio of stories, set in three of the world’s great cities. Illustrates the theme that people, no matter who they are, or where they live, share the basic human qualities of love, kindness, generosity and compassion. Shows a teenage girl in Amsterdam, a hard-pressed business man in Montreal and a wistful little boy in Mexico City in episodes displaying their response to other people’s needs.

results.title: The Whole world is watching
results.brief_description: An examination of the question of bias in television newscasting. Network executives and reporters discuss such topics as advertising influences on news content, where the responsibility for good news reporting lies, and whether or not television reports news or attempts to make it. Documents what has become a continuing discussion of television newscasters and balanced material.

results.title: The Whole works
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Basic Films, British Productivity Council and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: Records the reorganization of production in accordance with Work Study principles at a British engineering firm. The firm’s problem was that it made a variety of products in limited numbers and, in addition, worked in cramped buildings. Meetings and discussions over models and diagrams of the present system by which material moved up and down and in and out of the works, and plans of other systems, resulted in the designing of a more efficient flow line running at right angles to the previous one. This meant moving two hundred machines without stopping production. In addition, Departments were each grouped with their own stores and offices, and the production control office streamlined.
